A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
I love scifi and wanted this movie to be amazing. Instead\, the creators strove for mediocrity and that's exactly what we go. Lots of fan service\, boring (albeit cute) aliens\, and a lot of bullshit just to set up more movies. 

It was a fun watch\, but there were too many absolutely brain dead moments that soured things. For example: The rebels are running at max speed (can't use FTL travel) and the Empire are hot on their tails. NOBODY fucking notices a moon that the rebels could conveniently escape to. The Empire with all their advanced technology can't detect ships leaving for that moon. The writers/directors expect us to believe in a galaxy where everyone has FTL\, laser swords\, and magic powers nobody can use a fucking telescope. 

I want to know what happened to the guy that came up BB8. That's the guy who should be writing and directing Star Wars. He came up with a unique idea for a robot that could actually be created today. That man has more ingenuity and insight than all of the writers/producers/director on this movie. 

If you want to see a good scifi movie that's a sequel of an older film. Go watch Blade Runner 2049 instead.
